abstract.p: Golden Missile wins Stephen Foster Handicap at Churchill Downs in Louisville, KY (S)

block.p: The 3-year-old class may still be searching for a leader as racing nears midseason, but the senior class found one yesterday when Golden Missile went wire to wire on a sloppy track and won the $750,000 Stephen Foster Handicap at Churchill Downs in Louisville, Ky.
A 5-year-old son of A.P. Indy, Golden Missile outran favored Ecton Park by 2lengths. It was the seventh victory in 20 career starts for Golden Missile.

The 3-year-old class may still be searching for a leader as racing nears midseason, but the senior class found one yesterday when Golden Missile went wire to wire on a sloppy track and won the $750,000 Stephen Foster Handicap at Churchill Downs in Louisville, Ky.
A 5-year-old son of A.P. Indy, Golden Missile outran favored Ecton Park by 2lengths. It was the seventh victory in 20 career starts for Golden Missile.
Golden Missile ran the mile and an eighth under Kent Desormeaux in 1:49 2/5 and went home with $502,200.
At Belmont Park, meanwhile, favorites won the day's two stakes: Country Hideaway in the Vagrancy Handicap and Promontory Gold in the Hill Prince on the turf.

Country Hideaway defeated Hurricane Bertie by three-quarters of a length, with Imperfect World third. The winner, trained by Shug McGaughey with Jerry Bailey riding, ran the 6 furlongs in 1:17 and earned $65,640.
Promontory Gold ran the mile-and-an-eighth Hill Prince for 3-year-olds at Belmont Park in 1:49 and won by half a length over Rob's Spirit.Promontory Gold was ridden by Edgar Prado and earned $66,540.
